title.narrative: KI: Telecommunications and ICT Development Project

description.narrative: The proposed Project development objective is: to strengthen the legal, regulatory and institutional environment, enabling transition to a market-driven telecommunications sector and facilitating improved connectivity for the Outer Islands.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Communication, Transport, & Tourism Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Project Management Unit | Description :Central Fiduciary Unit established under Ministry of Finance and EconomicDevelopment. | Due Date :12-Oct-2012
Finance Agreement :Project Operations Manual | Description :Due 3 months after effectiveness. | Due Date : Delayed
Finance Agreement :Project Steering Committee | Description :Project Steering Committee already established and to be maintained. |Due Date :13-Oct-2010
Finance Agreement :Project Support Team | Description :Recruitment of ICT project manager in MCTTD pending. | Due Date :26-Mar-2013
Finance Agreement :Subsidiary Agreement | Description :Received by the Bank. | Due Date :12-Oct-2012

title.narrative: Component 2: Award of other telecommunications licenses.
Component 2: Number of direct beneficiaries (including % female).
Component 3: Internet penetration in Outer Islands (% population).
Decrease in tarrifs of mobile services and internet access - Price of 3 minute local mobile call.
Component 3: Mobile penetration in Outer Islands (% population)
Component 2: Internet broadband (minimum 256Kbps) subscribers (% of population).
Increase penetration of mobile telephones and Internet, including number of direct beneficiaries (% of population, of which 53% female)
Component 2: Updated telecom numbering plan adopted.

actual.value: 8 digit is now in place only for mobile and wireless fixed lines.

title.narrative: Increase penetration of mobile telephones and Internet in Outer Islands
Price of monthly internet serices (256 kbps)
Cost of 3 minute call to Australia

baseline.value: Basic ICT policy in place. Limited ICT policy capacity at MCTTD.

target.value: MICTTD completes review of all current ICT sector policies.

actual.value: ICT Policy no.2 developed and presented to Cabinet

baseline.value: Basic ICT policy in place. Limited ICT policy capacity

target.value: TSKL transformation and strategy fully implemented.

baseline.value: Existing spectrum plan designed for sole operator.

actual.value: Management system is now in place. Software has been purchased but need more training on the system.

target.value: New entrant licensed - Ocean Link. 5 Licensee SPs (ATHL, WIS, Ocean Link, Speedcast and Tenicom).

actual.value: Licensing regime operational - 6 individual, 13 class licensees

title.narrative: Component 2: Dispute and mediation procedures in place.

target.value: Dispute and mediation procedures in place

actual.value: Consumer Protection Rules finalized in August 2016. Consumer Protection is now in place.

target.value: Interconnection and Access rules finalized. ATHKL RIO adopted and published.

actual.value: Interconnection and Access rules has been finalized and approved.

title.narrative: Legal and regulatory framework more effective at delivering sector performance

baseline.value: Telecommunications Act 2004 and associated instruments in need of revision.

target.value: ACHIEVED: Sector laws and rules updated as appropriate in line with latest Government policy initiatives.

actual.value: Communications Act 2013 amended to improve legislation and CCK accountability - completed July 2018.
